definition: the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
if it isn't bright in the east, it'll be bright in the west (idiom)/if something doesn't work here, it might work somewhere else
pinyin: dong1 fang1 bu4 liang4 xi1 fang1 liang4

definition: (bird species of China) western capercaillie (Tetrao urogallus)
Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)
pinyin: xi1 fang1 ji2 le4 shi4 jie4

definition: (bird species of China) western sandpiper (Calidris mauri)
(bird species of China) water rail (Rallus aquaticus)

pinyin: xi1 fang1 ma3 nao3 yan2 bing4 du2

sentences.english: Unlike those of the West, Chinese loans are "no strings attached."
sentences.chinese: 不象西方國家，中國的貸款是“無附帶條件”。
我本質上是一個西方人。

sentences.english: Russia has long wished to keep the West away from its backyard.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯長久以來都渴望讓西方國家遠離他的後院。

sentences.english: The Western victors, however, have secured no such advantages.
sentences.chinese: 然而西方的勝利者卻無此優勢可佔。

sentences.english: On the other hand the West should not be panicked into unnecessary confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 其次，西方世界不該驚慌於同中國的衝突。

sentences.english: The former russian satellite now turn to the west for help.
sentences.chinese: 從前俄國的衛星國現在轉向西方要求援助。

sentences.english: It was a stopping point on the famous Silk Road between the East and the West .
sentences.chinese: 當時它是連接東西方的著名絲綢之路上的一個歇腳點。

sentences.english: A lot of Occidentals feel puzzled to this question.
sentences.chinese: 許多西方人對此感到困惑不解。

sentences.english: In the United States and most Western countries, however, most businesses are privately-owned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在美國和絕大多數西方國家。

sentences.english: Discuss the influence of religion on Western medical theories of sex.
sentences.chinese: 試論宗教對西方的性醫學理論的影響。

sentences.english: For centuries, Chinese wealth and power dwarfed the West’s.
sentences.chinese: 在好幾個世紀裏，中國的財富和權勢傲視西方。

sentences.english: The Chinese gather intelligence differently from Western nations, Wise writes.
sentences.chinese: 懷斯寫道，中國收集情報的方法與西方國家不同。

sentences.english: China has followed the West selectively since the May 4th Movement in 1919.
sentences.chinese: 自1919五四運動起，中國選擇性地尾隨西方。

sentences.english: For a long time, Hong Kong has embraced the Eastern and Western cultures.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，中西方文化在香港相互輝映，相互交融。

sentences.english: Western officials seem glumly reconciled to another term for Mr Karzai.
sentences.chinese: 西方官員似乎對卡爾扎伊的連任感到悶悶不樂。

sentences.english: It's a poem deeply invested, in fact, in the entire Western tradition of poetry in general.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，這是一首植根於，西方詩歌傳統的詩。

definition: the West (Europe and North America)/countries of the Indian Ocean (traditional)
to sinicize/to take on Chinese characteristics
